barriers.description: Temporary orange and white barriers on the road, signalling a split in the road with an opening towards the right-hand side, accompanied by a large yellow sign with arrows indicating the detour path around the obstacle.
barriers.explanation: This barrier setup alters the available driving paths, requiring the ego car to take the detour to the right, following the indicated path.

other objects.description: A stationary roadwork sign with a directional arrow, placed before the split in the road, indicating roadwork and the direction of the detour.
other objects.explanation: The presence of this sign is to inform road users of upcoming roadwork and to guide them along the correct path, avoiding the construction site.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic image, there are no vehicles or vulnerable road users present. Additionally, there are no traffic signs, traffic lights, or traffic cones to report. However, there are temporary orange and white barriers on the road, which signal a split in the road with an opening towards the right-hand side. These are accompanied by a large yellow sign with arrows indicating the detour path around the obstacle. The presence of these barriers requires the ego car to alter its driving path and take the detour to the right, following the indicated path. Furthermore, there is a stationary roadwork sign with a directional arrow placed before the split in the road. This sign indicates roadwork ahead and directs road users to the detour, guiding them away from the construction site to ensure safe navigation through the area.

2.description and explanation: This object appears to be a portable or temporary traffic barrier used in traffic management. It is designed with interlocking segments, probably made of plastic or light metal, which are colored in white and reddish or orange stripes for high visibility. This type of barrier is commonly used to guide traffic flow, demarcate road construction sites, or temporarily block access to certain areas for safety purposes. For the ego car, encountering such a barrier signifies that there might be road work ahead, a detour, or a closed section of the road. The driver of the ego car should be prepared to slow down, follow alternative routes, or adhere to the modified traffic patterns prompted by this barrier.

driving_suggestion: The ego car should reduce speed if necessary and prepare to follow the detour to the right as indicated by the road barriers and the directional signage. Remaining vigilant for any temporary changes in road rules and potential road workers or construction equipment in the vicinity is also advised.
